meanings.definition: Preferring or thriving in cold temperatures.
meanings.sent1: Penguins are cryophilic animals, loving the icy waters of Antarctica.
meanings.sent2: The cryophilic plants in the Arctic region have adapted to survive the harsh winters.
meanings.sent3: The cryophilic snowman refused to melt even when placed near a warm fireplace.
meanings.sent4: Her cryophilic personality kept her calm and collected even in the face of adversity.
meanings.sent5: The cryophilic landscape was a breathtaking sight, with snow-covered mountains as far as the eye could see.

meanings.definition: Organisms that are adapted to cold environments.
meanings.sent1: Arctic foxes are cryophilic, with thick fur to keep them warm in freezing temperatures.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study cryophilic bacteria to understand how life can thrive in extreme cold.
meanings.sent3: The cryophilic penguin waddled happily through the snow, unfazed by the chilly wind.
meanings.sent4: In the world of cryophilic creatures, the polar bear reigns supreme as the ultimate cold-weather predator.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the cryophilic depths of the ocean revealed a hidden world teeming with unique life forms.
